oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Aboagye Gyimah, Asantewaa
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this work, we describe protein folding kinetics, using the WSME model. This work is a follow-up of the research contained in a previous TFG at this institution, where the equilibrium of several artificial repeat proteins was analyzed; here we use the Local Equilibrium Approximation (LEA) to study the kinetics of the same proteins, to see how the length of the protein and the insertion of loops at different positions may affect the kinetics.We then study how folding/unfolding rates depend on the temperature, also run folding and unfolding simulations with increasing number of central repeats to see how the number of repeats affects the rate.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Universidad de Zaragoza; Departamento de Física Teórica; Área de Física Teórica
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Máster Universitario en Biotecnología Cuantitativa
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Estudio del comportamiento de proteinas modulares con modelos sencillos centrados en la estructura nativa
Study of the behavior of repeat proteins with simple native-centric models
